title: VLC Video Source renders portrait video with incorrect aspect ratio
body:
### Operating System Info

Windows 10

### Other OS

Also macOS 11.5.2 on M1

### OBS Studio Version

27.0.1

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/iMtIcCPaUcbCFDtI

### Expected Behavior

Portrait video from phone (mov/mp4 containing h.264/AVC and h.265/HEVC) should be rendered correctly in VLC Video Source.

### Current Behavior

Video is rotated to the correct orientation, but height and width are taken from the unrotated source, so the image is stretched horizontally.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18594548/132258767-5c5e10f5-7ff5-4f8f-a284-b2341cb59948.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. VLC Video Source to a scene.
2. Select the attached video as source.
3. Observe incorrect aspect ratio.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18594548/132258725-4ef35599-fab2-44c3-8262-60d5914ea876.MOV

### Anything else we should know?

Metadata in the affected videos specifies `rotation` of `90` or `270`.

Using VLC source to stream user-uploaded content (which is often but not always taken in portrait on a phone) and "fit to screen" transform, so I can't work around by applying fixed transforms as the media dimensions and orientation change constantly.

VLC itself plays the videos correctly.

Reproduced on Windows 10 and MacOS 15.2.1 on M1.
